{{Location Intro|{{Lang|'''Nantianmen'''|zh=南天门|zh_rm=Nántiānmén|zh_tl=Southern Heavenly Gate}}|description=<p>This region notably features the [[Dragon-Queller]], a large tree used to seal [[Azhdaha]], whom [[Jiu]] worships. The dragon has begun merging with the tree, using its roots to connect to the ley lines and draw power from them.</p><p>At the tip of the tree is a large blue branch, which points directly towards [[Liyue Harbor]]. That portion of the tree also cannot be climbed on.</p>}}

==Trivia==
===Etymology===
* In the Chinese mythology, the {{Lang|''Nántiānmén''|zh=南天门|zh_tl=Southern Heavenly Gate}} refers to the main gate of the {{w|Jade Emperor}}'s palace. The gate is considered to be a boundary between the mortal realm and the heavenly realm.
* In the real world, it also refers to a sacred gate of {{w|Mount Tai}} (Taishan), one of the five holiest mountains of China, which was first constructed in 1264 by the Taoist monk Zhang Zhichun.
